title: The Ghost Election
outcome: A citywide election for a new Civic Forum is organized as a practical test of autonomy and trust. However, old BCI selection algorithms, still quietly active, begin ‘pre-selecting’ unexpected candidates—many being formerly invisible or previously flagged citizens. The revelation that Halden had set the BCI to manipulate leadership succession for maximum disruption triggers public debate. The election exposes divisions, as some support algorithmic order while others demand raw popular choice.

events.description: Districts agree to hold elections for a Civic Forum, sparking anticipation across Stenograd.
IT teams discover dormant BCI algorithms have started pre-selecting and promoting unexpected candidates for key Civic Forum positions.
Documents reveal that Halden programmed the BCI to manipulate future leadership, intending disruption to break Council and citizen complacency.
Districts erupt in debate—some citizens prefer algorithmic impartiality in leadership, while others rally for direct, popular elections devoid of BCI influence.
A tense, highly visible Civic Forum is formed with a mixed slate. Its legitimacy is questioned, but citywide discussion marks a shift in how Stenograd chooses its future leaders.
